title: Designing Strategies for Integrating Computational Thinking (CT) in Early Childhood Education

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: This study explores the application of Design-Based Research (DBR) and Interest-Driven Creator (IDC) theory for integrating Computational Thinking (CT) in early childhood education. Practical competencies are strengthened through iterative activity design and feedback based on simulated classroom scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can design CT-integrated educational strategies combining DBR (Design-Based Research) and IDC (Instructional Design for Complexity) theories
Develop at least three CT (Computational Thinking) activities (unplugged/plugged) suitable for early childhood developmental stages
Structure problem-solving scenarios that promote learner engagement in sequential phases

resources: Digital Tools for Educational Practice (Robots, Tablets, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
